newsitem.title: USA: BEC Group says court dismisses judgment.
newsitem.headline: BEC Group says court dismisses judgment.

text.p: BEC Group Inc said on Friday that a U.S. district court had dismissed an action filed by American Greetings Corp seeking to declare that American Greetings had not breached a confidentiality agreement with the company.
The confidentiality agreement referred to a proposed purchase by American Greetings of BEC's former Foster Grant Group business, BEC said in a statement.
BEC entered into a letter of intent with American Greetings regarding the proposed purchase in August. In September, American Greetings withdrew, BEC said.

"BEC is vigorously pursuing its own action in Dallas County, Texas, against American Greetings, its Magnivision, Inc subsidiary and its senior vice present, Erwin Weiss, alleging breach of the confidentiality agreement, unfair competition, defamation, fraud and misrepresentation," BEC said.
It added that BEC is seeking damages in excess of $18 million in the case.
BEC Group manufactures electronic and electroformed products, and markets sunglasses, sport shields and goggles in the United States, Mexico and Costa Rica.
